chunks.en: Talking again about age and job hunting, many people overestimate themselves and don't recognize their own limitations.
Seeing many people with average education and over 40 years old, all asking for salaries of around 30K~50K~80K+ per month,
1. Where did they get the confidence to demand such high salaries? Or do they just think they are worth this price and won't work for anything less?
2. Or is it that their previous companies paid them so much, so they demand the same?
3. Did the platform ultimately make you successful, or are you really worth that number?
Can't work for 8K or 15K? Then why are you looking for a job?
Average education, older age, and no achievements or promotions.
Don't worry, you'll live to be 40 one day. If you don't, then never mind.
If you remove the introduction and conclusion from these words, they actually apply to you now. Please voluntarily reduce your salary.
If you've ever hired people and aren't in HR, you'll know how foolish it is to be solely focused on academic qualifications.
It's foolish to judge people based on a single dimension.
Work ability is also multi-dimensional, and a team needs people with outstanding skills in various areas.

Originally, I wasn't interested in replying to this post, but seeing you so diligently promoting your ridiculous and foolish focus on academic qualifications on a forum for slackers on a Saturday, and even going to someone else's post where they were sincerely looking for a job to promote it, I couldn't help but reply.
And don't try to flatter yourself by saying you'd be willing to work for 8k at 40.
How old are you now, and what is your monthly salary?
Why do you think you'll be worth 8k when you're 40?
On a weekend, do you have no hobbies, no life, or do you have to work overtime on Saturday so you come here to slack off?
If you have so much free time, you might as well improve your understanding.

OP, your writing level is comparable to Arnold's, misusing formatting paragraphs, misusing punctuation, omitting subjects randomly, and also using bizarre expressions like '30K~50K~80K+ monthly salary'.
In fact, older workers can't even get their resumes past the screening stage if they ask for a 10K salary.
This lackey reminds me of Lu Xun's words: 'Mutual harm among the lower classes is the nature of slaves.' Slaves will even laugh at you for not kneeling in the correct posture.
Enough nonsense, OP I f**k your mother.
Average education, older age, are they eating your rice? Why so much malice?
If you're hiring, just assess whether the candidate's abilities meet the job requirements, and whether the salary you can offer is satisfactory to them. Why so many internal thoughts?
If you think someone's abilities are insufficient and they're asking for too much, just politely decline. It's all market behavior, perfectly understandable.
The environment in China is really bad. In the US, a 40-year-old engineer is in their prime earning years. For example, my Tech Lead makes at least $300,000 a year.
I don't understand the logic at all, it feels like you're just here to get copper coins.
If you think their abilities aren't worth the corresponding salary, then choose capable young people.
If it's because you can't pay the corresponding salary, then hire people who fit your price range.

Unless you can only judge a job seeker's ability based on their years of experience, and then the job's price isn't competitive in the market, it seems like you're not solving any problems besides exposing your own incompetence by posting this, after all, older workers have plenty of experience being PUA'd.

Lower-class laborers, taking advantage of the era's benefits and gaining power for a time, stand on so-called high ground and boss people around, but don't forget, if you haven't escaped your own class, the boomerang will always hit you one day.
Ability and work ethic have little to do with age.
If someone has the ability and attitude at forty, it's understandable to ask for that much (whether there are so many senior positions is another question).

Of course, how much someone asks also depends on the market environment. With the internet in a downturn, there are more people than jobs, and it's hard to find one if you don't lower your expectations.
But if someone is currently making 30~80K, their ability is definitely no longer that of a junior engineer, it's unlikely to directly lower to 8K~15K to do a junior job.
The market isn't bad to that extent.
I feel that LZ's company may not have much money and thinks that they can cheaply find cost-effective older engineers now that the economy is bad.
But everyone would rather lie at home than be a hard-working laborer.
This should be the biggest contradiction that LZ's company is facing.

chunks.en: If you changed 'programmer' to '40+ older single woman', I feel that no one would criticize you. It would be the opposite, mainly because V2EX users will actually reach 40+, but most V2EX users are not female.
This OP is a bit of an idiot.

First, it implies age discrimination; (the subtext is that people should retire at 35, and if they still have a job at 40, even if it's sweeping toilets, they should be grateful, and not be picky or ask for high salaries?)

Second, ability discrimination without any factual basis; (it's everyone's right to ask for whatever price they want. If you want to know why someone is asking for that price, you should humbly ask them to justify it, instead of complaining)

Third, discrimination against people themselves; (what is a platform? Without people, what's a platform worth? Isn't even the most powerful country supported by taxpayers? Complaining, your mind isn't right, the lower beam is crooked.)
Can't afford to hire people, so you're triggered.
Typical Chinese thinking, pure utilitarianism, Darwinism, actually typical of people with outdated thinking.
From a macro perspective, the previous version of utilitarianism and Darwinism ultimately led to fascism and the World War.

From a micro perspective, we treat the elderly kindly and sympathize with the weak because we may all become weak in some area, don't you ever have times when you aren't in good shape or may need to move away from utilitarianism.

chunks.en: Hope OP can also take a 15k salary at 40, and be very happy.

@ily433664 If you can't find a job for 8K, it can only be lower, 6K. If the country allows deflation to 800, then you have to do it. It seems that society cannot tolerate wage cuts or economic deflation.

chunks.en: Are you a worker? Why are you betraying your class and defending the interests of capitalists? I rarely use exclamation marks in my speech. Look carefully: you have betrayed your class!!! You have betrayed your class!!! You have betrayed your class!!!
On the contrary, you can only recognize yourself after you get older.
When you first graduate, you don't know your own value and are willing to be a hard worker for 8k or 10k.
